metadata.title: CVE-2023-25729 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Permission prompts for opening external schemes were only shown forContentPrincipals resulting in extensions being able to openthem without user interaction via ExpandedPrincipals. Thiscould lead to further malicious actions such as downloading files orinteracting with software already installed on the system. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR <102.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
